Brennen Green

I am a computer science and mathematics student at the University of Kentucky. I am inspired by the intersection of Computer Graphics, Geometry, and Artificial Intelligence. As a researcher I have explored this intersection first hand. With experience working in both a biomedical imaging laboratory, and a sustainable manufacturing institute building computer vision driven machine learning models. Professionaly I have also had the amazing experience to work at Twitch building tools for mobile gamers to enjoy streaming just as much as their PC and console counter parts. Before that I worked at Intel and the University of Kentucky in various roles. I hope to continue pursuing a career to inspire people through Film and Games. In the summer of 2022 I will be joining the World of Warcraft team at Blizzard Entertainment as a Technical Artist/Graphics Programming Intern.
My passion is for enabling the development of inspiration and entertaining works of arts. Assiting artists by providing the necesssary tooling, technology, and pipelines to fulfill their artistic vision in the most frictionless environment possible.
When I'm not obsessing over computer graphics however, you can find me playing games, cooking, skating, surfing or doing anything outdoors!

Experience

Research

My academic research falls into primarily two areas: Computer Graphics and Machine Learning. As a undergraduate research assistant at UK I worked in both imaging and machine learning. While working in a biomedical imaging lab I developed an optimized biomedical imaging device that would allow the reconstruction of cerebral bloodflow using CUDA and MATLAB. Currently I am researching the applications of convolutional neural networks to characterize part defects and optimize manufacturing processes with the Institute of Sustainable Manufacturing at UK. The bulk of my work involves heavy amounts of data analysis and processing using Python and tools such as Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, CUDA, and Pandas to enable my machine learning workflow.

Software Development

My experience as a software developer has a lot of breadth. I have had the unique opportunity to be involved with many areas of software development. From processor design and validation, devops, web development, and currently app and video streaming development. I've had the pleasure to work professionally at Twitch, Intel Corporation, and the University of Kentucky. Most recently, I have been working at Twitch as an Android Graphics Engineer building OpenGL ES pipelines that render dynamic content on which helps to enable our content creators to provide the best viewing experience and branding possible. Follow me on my next quest in the Summer of 2022 when I join the World of Warcraft team at Blizzard Entertainment as a Graphics Programming Intern.

  • LinkedIn
  • Resume

Personal Projects

Personally, my work is focused entirely on computer graphics. Typically I am working on some sort of rendering engine, both physically based and real-time. I have written several rendering algorithms from scratch for my own developmental purposes as well. My goal at the moment is to maintain two fully functional engines. One for real-time optimization work and another for photorealistic work. In development with these engines I typically work with Modern C++, OpenGL, and Vulkan. Outside of that I try to remain constantly involved with the open-source community; in the past I have contributed to both Blender and Godot Engine.
